Reviews.Title: “Good value, older building, iffy neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Wings-it
Reviews.Content: We paid just ov $100 night for two nights, which we budgeted for. There was a mixup with my reservation but they kindly gave me the older, lower rate. The hotel was built in 1929 and besides the TV and wi-fi, (and microwave and fridge) little seems upgraded. This is kind of cool in a city dripping with history like San Francisco but I might have thought it kind of grotty elsewhere... The bathroom had those tiny hexagon tiles on the floor, which reminded me of my first apartment 40 years ago (as did the quaint wood cabinets and fittings of the kitchenette) but I could not help worrying how clean they could get it, really. Some of the grouting was a bit worrisome too. I asked for a quiet back room and I got 509 which looked into the window of the next door building, which I thought was fine, planning only to sleep here, (and there were good blinds) but my partner did not like it. Pluses: beds comfy, handy fridge and microwave (with a nicely stocked market downstairs). Decent continent breakfast included, not fancy (toast, instant oatmeal, hardboiled egg, juice, coffee/tea, apples, cookies) enough to get you out the door. The elevator is a funny antique that takes some getting used to, but you can pinch your hand in the metal gate. One caution: we found the walk up Jones street from Market 9pm at night full of very scary characters...it is not a good neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay -First Time in SF”
Reviews.Author: kiana m
Reviews.Content: I searched tons and tons of hotels and read hundreds of reviews to finally find the Hotel Mayflower! It was our very first time in SF, and wanted a place in the center of the beauty. This hotel is in the most perfect location- blocks from union square and both cable car turnarounds! Bus stops super close, at least 5 coffee shops within close walking distance- just cannot beat this location. The hotel itself was perfect! FREE parking! Yes it's a small garage and you have to have a small car to get down there, but what a great value! Our room was on the 5th floor and was so quaint and cute, small bed, but it felt like our own little SF apartment, with a mini fridge, microwave, silverware cups and plates, and the best part a WALK IN CLOSET! so perfect! The staff was super friendly and helpful with directions and such. Would definitely recommend and will stay here again and again on our next trip to SF!

Reviews.Title: “A great 3* hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: AnnalisaCM
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I split our stay in San Francisco in two, deciding to book two hotels in two different areas of the city to get to know it better over the period of 12 nights/13 days. The Mayflower Hotel was the first of our stay at the end of March for 6 nights and we were happily looked after by all staff throughout. The room was comfortable and very spacious, with even a walk-in wardrobe and a kitchenette with fridge, microwave and a small selection of plates, cutlery, mugs and glasses. It was really good to know that we could be reasonably self-sufficient, though the hotel is so well situated that within minutes you can find wonderful restaurants whether you head West along Bush Street or East. Next door, you'll also find the Mayflower deli shop, which sells lots of groceries and has a deli counter too if you wish to make use of the microwave. Union Square is nearby too and barely a 10 minutes walk from the hotel and there you'll be really spoiled for choice. And from the hotel, you'll be also very close to the Cable Cars line on Powell Street so you'll be able to hop on if the cable car isn't too busy for $6 per trip. From Union Square, many of the hopper bus tours set off so watch out for the lines doing the downtown tour, the Golden Gate Park tour and the Golden Gate Bridge tour, all of which are well worth it. Some companies over these together, which you can cover over a period of 48 hours, at a special price. We did this and thought it was worth every penny. About the position of our room (11 I seem to remember, 1st floor and end of the corridor), it really was well situated, with even an avocado tree outside! Shame we couldn't reach the actual fruits because it was loaded! It did not face the main street and I would advise you ask for this because Bush Street can get busy. The bed was very comfortable so we slept well every night. The bathroom too was good, clean, with the basic essentials and a bath tub with a powerful shower head. When it came to breakfast, again I think it was good value for money, though staying there for 7 days, we felt it became a little bit monotonous after a while. Every morning it was either porridge or toast with jam, peanut butter or chocolate spread, or cheese slices and boiled egg, and biscuits / muffins. Still, again it was good for the overall stay and you could always choose to go out instead and sample a special American breakfast at one of the many nearby cafes. Drinks-wise, the coffee and orange juice served for breakfast were delicious. All in all, we were very pleased with it and would recommend it highly for the budget traveller. For us, the key factors for our first week in San Francisco were budget and location, and ideally a welcoming smile when we got there (our first time in the US). We got everything, so for us, it ticked all the boxes.

Reviews.Title: “As good as 3* hotel might be”
Reviews.Author: Zeituni
Reviews.Content: Very central, nice property with Art Deco touch, clean, simple breakfast Very efficient staff - provided us with phone charger, suitcase scales etc. Booking without prepayment.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for bed and breakfast, close to everything, loved the 1920s style building”
Reviews.Author: ants1970
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, close to everything, free underground car park, for small cars only, breakfast was okay for a quick sit and go meal, rooms impeccably clean, was on third floor no noise, WiFi was a headache though couldn't get much reception, mattress was beautiful to sleep in, very affordable would use again....

Reviews.Title: “Great location but you get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: AJ115
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the hotel is the location and the cost. The staff on arrival were not very professional and didn't seem to what us there. Our room had an off-putting smell (we had to spray perfume to cover it) and all the furniture was tired and old with the fridge hanging off the wall. The bed was very soft and not very comfortable. They claim to have a garage but our car (Mustang) wouldn't fit in so you may as well add $20 fee for each 24hrs you wish to stay the accommodation costs. Breakfast was very limited but the cookies and muffins were nice. In a nutshell cheap and cheerful but a central location and you just need somewhere to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “the hotel is very good price for value!”
Reviews.Author: ILU00
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Mayflower hotel for a week in March 2012. We liked the place - it is not new, but clean and neat. Besides, it is a walking distance from the Union Square, it is quiet and there are many small and nice restaurants in the area. The staff were just excellent - very helpful and welcoming every day of our stay there. When we asked for a hairdryer, ironing board, iron, even a vase, they gave these to us at once. Plus there's a nice library/computer in the hotel, wifi. And what is really great - there's a small kitchenette (microvawe, fridge, sink, glasses and plates) and a small wardrobe room in your room. We will definitely stay there next time!

Reviews.Title: “cheapest frisco treat”
Reviews.Author: candegurrl25
Reviews.Content: Place is clean, creepy little haunt. Old school elevator, strange furniture in the rooms, feels like grandmas apartment. Close to the wharf, union station and chinatown. The price is right and you won't be in your room much so its perfect. They are helpful at the front desk also. Cons...parking is 2 long blocks away and 20$ a night, free parking if your car is smaller then a mini coupe.For some reason the room we got was above the alley where the loudest and longest trash pick up ever existed....at 5 am... nobody seemed to be staying there on a mon night in winter, so why not give us a quiet room, perhaps on a lower floor.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: daai
Reviews.Content: We had a very happy stay here. It is fairly cheap by San Francisco standards so you can’t expect too much but for us it ticked all the boxes. The room was quite big and the décor was plain but fine, it was also clean. The room included a walk in wardrobe and a kitchenette which was great. The bathroom was also fine. I think the hotel has lots of character with its quaint lift and wooden balcony. The reception staff were all helpful friendly and seemed very genuine. There’s internet access on a few computers on the first floor study area which is convenient. We really enjoyed the breakfast, there’s a great selection of basic items to set you up for the day. The hotel location is also really good. Over all we were very happy with our decision to stay in the Mayflower and would have no hesitation recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for offer”
Reviews.Author: aridari
Reviews.Content: it is what it is, an inner city downtown hotel, international category of 2 or 3 stars. our room was very quiet. WiFi was free but at times low signal. Beds were clean and no bugs detected.. Bushy Street made a safe and clean impression, something you cannot say about the roads a few blocks south, namely Turk, Powell, Geary etc. Overall, at just over $100 for a 2double bedded room, it was more than ok.

Reviews.Title: “A Peaceful retreat”
Reviews.Author: eire1950
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mayflower Hotel and found it to be quite satisfactory and will be staying there again in April as I found it very convenient to everything. The room was larger than average and it had lots of storage space plus a bathroom. I would recommend it highly for the average budget traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Full of character, clean rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: hellofish
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by this place! I paid approximately $100 per night (shared with a friend) - which is the same place that we were paying for our dump of a hostel in LA (a dump of a city). For this price, we got a very spacious room complete with a kitchenette, a full bathroom, and a walk in closet! The hotel is full of character - from the retro style lobby, to the ancient, tiny elevator. However, the rooms were very clean and the Wi-Fi (free) was very strong and reliable. Breakfast was basic but adequate. The neighbourhood felt safe - and was in walking distance (if you don't mind walking up hills! Though that's universal to San Francisco) to Chinatown and Union Square - which is the main public transport hub. The street is predominantly residential, with a few shops - so we had no problem with noise keeping us awake at night. We'd read some bad things about The Tenderloin, and decided that this place was far enough away from it - which it seemed to be. Taxis in San Fran are also relatively cheap, so you can get home from places like The Castro pretty easily. :) I'm very glad we stayed here rather than Fisherman's Wharf, which is a complete tourist trap!

Reviews.Title: “Nice base for an SF conference”
Reviews.Author: Craxiter
Reviews.Content: I booked direct with the hotel in September and got a good rate during the busy AGU meeting in December. Bush is a bit far from the Moscone Center where the meeting is held, and a Metro pass pays off quickly since riding the cable car up the hill is a good idea, especially if carrying a laptop. Nice breakfast with good choice of mostly cold items (but instant oatmeal) including healthy choices I passed over in favor of the home-made cookies. Very nice staff who when hearing my concerns that a street-facing room might be noisy, allowed me to pay just two nights initially. The street was in fact no problem. Overall a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Mayflower at Thanksgiving”
Reviews.Author: h0rsew0man
Reviews.Content: We went to San Francisco to visit our son for Thanksgiving. He does not have an apartment big enough for us, so we stayed at the Mayflower where we had been a couple of years ago. For $103 including tax and parking we had a nice room with a little view. Beds are sometimes a problem for us, but we got separate beds and they were fine. Spotlessly clean. And a little kitchenette. We could open the windows for fresh air. The garage is only good for compact cars as the hotel is from 1916 I believe. All this included a quite adequate breakfast. The big surprise was that on Thanksgiving day they cooked a Thanksgiving feast for all in the hotel, staff and guests. We did not partake as we had other plans, but can you believe???? The area is a bit out of the tourist center, but safe and there is a well stocked deli market right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: d o
Reviews.Content: This place is like a little apartment in SF. The lady and I came here for a special getaway, and everything about this place was awesome! Got on the fifth floor on Bush street, high enough from the noise but still a pretty view! People who work here is amazing as well!

Reviews.Title: “Plan on Returning”
Reviews.Author: johnnyscaccia
Reviews.Content: We got to the city with no accommodation orgainzed, our taxi driver recommended the Mayflower. We gave them a buzz and was offered a rate of $124 inclusive of tax. Was a bit eager to see what this hotel was really all about since I didn't do much research on it, but everything was certainly up to par. This small 93 room hotel is easy to pass by on the street, but once through the doors the lobby area opens up to a charming, well decorated, comfortable lounge/front desk area. Check in was a breeze with their friendly staff. The room was well appointed with big windows with heaps of natural light, kitchenette, flat screen TV, massive closet, complimentary WIFI access, and city street view (which I enjoy since I'm not from the city.) They also offer complimentary breakfast in the mornings! Yes, the building itself is older..but thats the charm of old victorian SF. Despite the age of the hotel, everything was clean and comfy. I will definitely recommend this to friends, and look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Jasonleongcm
Reviews.Content: The location is good and provides parking. There is no air conditioning and hotel looks a bit old but overall value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near union square”
Reviews.Author: Charmosa1
Reviews.Content: It was a great hotel at a reasonable rate for San Francisco. It was clean, quiet and well located. We chose the back of the hotel bc it was quiet side (there is no view which was fine by us). Only a few blocks from union square. Parking was included, although it's a tight squeeze! We had no trouble with the WiFi in the rooms so were very happy with that. Breakfast was included but we didn't eat much of it as it lacked protein - mainly coffee, bread/toast, peanut butter, nutella, muffins/pastries/baked goods, homemade cookies, yogurt and cereal. As many other reviews have said, the closet is huge! The bathtub was also a bit deeper than standard hotel tubs which made for a nice soak at the end of day after walking all day. We also asked for a newer mattress as possible so felt the bed was pretty comfortable. It's up some pretty large hills which was good exercise. It's not in the best neighborhood but it didn't affect us - just walk towards union square and it's fine. Value for money is definitely there and we would return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: RayleighTasha_1985
Reviews.Content: When you consider what you get for your money this place is a gem! Located on bush street, 10 minutes to union square, Chinatown etc and 5 min walk to Powell street where you can get th cable car to fishermans wharf via crookedest street. Parking was free, as was breakfast and wifi - all for $103.95 per night Inc tax! We got a double room on 5th floor and didn't hear any street noise at all. This is an old building and they have kept it that way. If you like character then this place is for you. If you like standard hotel rooms like Marriott etc then it is not! Room was spacious and clean. Breakfast was not the best we have seen on our travels as no cereal or yoghurt. Was toast and eggs with some dry muffins and cookies so not great but does the job. Wi fi is again not the fastest but it does work at an acceptable speed. Yes the entrance to the car park is narrow, we had a Chevrolet Malibu and it squeezed in just fine! You might scratch your wheels if your car is any wider than this and you must have folding wing mirrors otherwise they will be damaged! Don't worry about the tenderloin area - this hotel is further from it than the Fairmont!

Reviews.Title: “great value, good location, staff very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Ozcouple123
Reviews.Content: I researched this hotel as we wanted something near Union square at a reasonable cost. We were very surprised by the hotel, our room had a nice new kitchen and nice view. Staff were very helpful and added bonus was the breakfast every morning ...you could smell the home baking...would certainly recommended it to anyone we stayed 6 nights

Reviews.Title: “Great room, staff, location and value.”
Reviews.Author: JoaoVicenteSm
Reviews.Content: Me, my girlfriend and her parents stayed at the Mayflower hotel for two nights last month. The hotel is well located, justa a few blocks from the Union Square and from the Grace Cathedral. The staff was extremely nice to all of us. The breakfast has just what we needed to start the day: coffee, breads, mufins, cookies, cheese, eggs, etc. The hotel is a bit old, but the rooms are well cleaned and mine even had flat screen TV. The rooms also had a small kitchen with coffee maker, microwave and a mini-bar. So... for me it wasn't a perfect hotel because, like I said, but the service, the location, the staff and the room are great.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic value! friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: jenjens31
Reviews.Content: great value! i was a bit hesitant when i was quoted $92 (including tax) for a room so close to union square on a weekend... free breakfast? free parking? and $92 a night? hmmmm i was skeptical especially when they didn't ask for my credit card number to hold the room when i made the reservation. but boy was i surprised! the room isn't fancy, it felt like i was staying in the spare room at grandmas's house. but there was a kitchenette complete with fridge, microwave, and dishes. and really, who wants fancy... you're in SF! you are supposed to be out exploring!!! i was there for the nike women's marathon, and they even opened the continental breakfast early for the runners. very accommodating! my friends were staying at another hotel a few blocks down which was twice as much, had less room, and check out was firm at 11am, even though 99% of their hotel was full of runners. im afraid to ask how much extra they were charged by not getting back to the room until noon :( the free parking is literally for small cars only. i have a two door honda civic, and i still managed to scratch my bumper coming out of the basement parking. the only reason i can't give this five stars is that you have to bring your patience. there is only one person working to check people in/out, help with directions, opening the parking doors, etc. i will be staying here for all my future trips to san francisco for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money & well located”
Reviews.Author: Mlinci
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mayflower for a total of eight nights in September/October 2011. Hotels in San Francisco tend to be very expensive, and we needed something affordable for an eight night stay. I am pleased we chose the Mayflower. By British standards it was a bargain - about £68 per night - $104 per night inclusive of tax. The hotel location is great: 2 minute walk (up a ridiculously steep hill!) to the California line cable car, 2 minute walk downhill to the other two cable car lines, 10 minute walk to either Chinatown or Union Square. The street the hotel is on, Bush Street, is very pleasant, and there is a good grocery store right by the hotel, and dozens of restaurants within a ten minute walk. I am happy we didn't choose to stay immediately around the Union Square area, as it is too loud and busy for our liking; the fact that we were a few minutes' walk from the it was actually an advantage. Breakfast was simple , but tasty: toast, muffins, some scones (yummy!), boiled eggs, sliced cheese (which was very tasty!), peanut butter, tea, coffee, orange juice. Staff were overall unintrusive and efficient, check in and checkout were very quick (as we had no extras to worry about ). There were a couple of staff members we saw most of the time - a young man who was efficient if slightly disinterested, and a lady with short blond hair who was absolutely lovely. WiFi in the room wasn't the greatest, but it just about worked, and there were two computers for the guests' use on the first floor, which also had a lovely sitting area. The only downside I can really think of is that some of the rooms have a view of the wall opposite the hotel which makes these rooms a bit dark, but if you are planning to spend more time at the hotel itself I guess you can ask for a room with a better view. The bathrooms were clean, with lots of towels and good quality soaps and shampoos. There was loads of storage space in the room, with a walk in closet. Oh, and the sushi restaurant on the corner of Bush and Taylor was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and Comfy hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: pinkchouchong
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Mayflower in early October 2011 for four nights. It is very centrally located, less than ten minutes walk to Union Square where all the shops are. There is a grocery shop right next door, which is very convenient to get snacks and drinks. The hotel itself is full of character, starting with the lobby, which is so full of old charm. Each room has a name and handpainted drawing. The room is very cosy and clean, the beds and pillows very comfortable. It's great to have a walk-in closet, where we could put away the suitcases and overcoats. We rented a car driving from LA to SF, so it was very convenient that the hotel does have its own parking lot, so we didn't have to worry about looking for a parking space. The staff were very friendly. The self-service breakfast is sufficient to fill up the belly, quite a lot of choices, though nothing heavy. A couple cons: There is no coffee maker or teapot for making coffee or tea, so had to use the microwave to heat up water, which was not very convenient. Wireless internet is not very stable, a bit frustrating at times. All in all, really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Mayflower and would recommand this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money in central SF”
Reviews.Author: naturalb0rntraveller
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here which was great value for money given it's location, continental breakfast included and close to most forms of local transport. The room was spacious with city views n decent size bathroom. The staff were great as well! Overall a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Staying in San Francisco in Style”
Reviews.Author: El_wooff
Reviews.Content: The Mayflower gives you the feeling of style. it's a well maintained historical building with competent and very friendly staff and a lot of attention paid to details. the room i stayed in was on the 6th floor quiet, spacious and pleasant. it was not the cheapest room they have but all the others were booked out. check in was a little bit worrying because they hadn't got my keys ready and at first couldn't find my reservation information but the only resulted in a few minutes longer at the check in desk. i booked at the Mayflower due to the reasonable price, the proximity from union square and the reviews here on Trip Advisor and was not disappointed. If you are coming from the airport, don't confuse downtown shuttle services for 11 dollars with the hotel courtesy services for free but only for certain hotels (this may be something, which only happens to foreigners). a taxi from the airport will cost you 55 dollars. The staff can and will recommend places to eat and advise you on how to get around. I stayed two nights at the Mayflower to meet up with a few friends and explore San Francisco for a day. i thoroughly enjoyed my stay and would totally recommend this Hotel Have Fun

Reviews.Title: “Staying in S F”
Reviews.Author: NLGroby
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family of four at The Mayflower inAugust with our room on the 3rd floor. Our room was clean and tidy with what turned out to be more than enough space to hang all of our clothes, 2 adults and 2 teenagers. The hotel appears to have kept a good deal of its original characater with the old fashioned lifts (elevators) as well as a good deal of the decor. The continental breakfast , though the same everyday, was more than ample to keep us all going to lunchtime. Both of the ladies were very helpful with any questions we had regarding SF and keen to ensure that you have a pleasant stay in the hotel. It is not that bad a walk to downtown or China Town, we did both, as well as catching the cable car from California & Hyde. Overall we felt that the hotel gave very good value for money. The only negative is the lack of hotel parking, but I was given a good rate at an off street parking garage around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of character”
Reviews.Author: KlutterBc
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Mayflower. The location was perfect- very central to Union Square, China Town, and a reasonable walk to Fisherman's Wharf. There were a couple of restaurants only a few doors down and several more within a few blocks. The convenience store right next door was handy as well. It is an older hotel, but we expected that from reading reviews. We found it to be very clean and the staff were very friendly. Our room was plenty big enough, the closets were huge-my mother used hers as her own private dressing room. The beds were super comfortable and I liked the non-institutional looking bedding. The included breakfast was nothing fancy, but perfectly acceptable and the computers were available whenever I wished to check emails. I also really liked the old elevator and lobby area. The only negative had nothing to do with the hotel and it concerned our trip on a shuttle back to the airport. The front desk gave us a coupon (for $5 off I believe), and called a shuttle service for us. It was a very scary ride back to the airport. Unfortunately I can not remember the name of the service. The five of us riding in the van were all very relieved to arrive at the airport in one piece.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 'inexpensive' SF hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: upright_infinity
Reviews.Content: Stayed here several days over Labor Day Weekend. I stayed in a queen room towards the back of the hotel (the 'quieter' part of the hotel, as it did not face the street). The price was a really good deal for San Francisco and the location (you'll find that out if you do a hotel research in the downtown area). As most reviewers have stated, the room I got was very clean and well taken care of. The bathroom was immaculate and the towels were actually soft! The little 'kitchenette' area was a plus. The mini fridge worked fine. I didn't use either the dishes or microwave available. There was a huge closet which I did utilize and a little seating area which I used for my laptop. The bed and sheets were clean and comfortable. The room did get a little stuffy at times with the windows closed (you can open them) but there is a ceiling fan in the room, and I think a heater but I didn't need to use that. The carpet was also clean, the room was a good size for one person, and it was even painted with scenes on the walls and on the door. It was pretty quiet, I didn't really hear my neighbors and only very occasionally people outside the hallway. The floors creaked and I was worried that people below could hear that, but I haven't read any reviewers complain. I got a kick out of the old fashioned elevators. Also, above the lobby on the first floor there are a few computers with internet access and a printer. I did use the printer to print out my boarding pass. Some amenities that I enjoyed are the free wifi (the access was good in my room), and the breakfast in the mornings, which is okay (toast, cookies, mini scones, oatmeal, applesauce, apples, hard boiled eggs, coffee and oj). The hotel does have free parking, and I was a little disappointed that I couldn't park my car for the one night I had one because they only have twenty spots available (hey have 90 rooms) and you have to reserve it in advance on a first come first served basis which I didn't realize. The staff was very friendly and helpful and I didn't find any problems with them. I liked the location even if it wasn't just a few steps away from most major tourist attractions or transportation. But I think San Francisco is best scene and experienced by foot anyway and I didn't mind the walking (although my feet would argue differently!). There are two little markets close by, one right next door and one just across the street which I found very convenient for buying water and snacks. There's also a small pizza place close by which is okay, and a couple of laundry mats in the near vicinity. Overall, I had a really great experience at the Hotel Mayflower and I would and have recommended it to friends and would definitely stay here again if I'm in SF again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Akhil S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic, the location is perfect, being about a 10 min walk from downtown, chinatown, cable car meuseum and a 30 min walk from the popular Fishermans wharf area. Just about any kind of restaurant you want is within 5 minutes walk too, I saw (and ate at) Thai, Japanese, Indian, Italian, Mexican, and all delicious! It is well connected, a 5 minute walk will get you to busses that will take you just about anywhere in San Francisco. If you don't want to walk or bus, it also has free parking for around 40 cars underground (first come first served call before to see if they have a space for you). The hotel has an air of history about it, being built in the early 1900's, but kept modern with TVs and Wi fi in the rooms. The rooms themselves are spacious and clean and the staff is super friendly, always ready to have a chat and help you. My room didn't have much of a view, looking straight onto another buildings brick wall, I didn't mind as I was hardly there, I'm not sure if all the rooms are like that, you can probably ask when you make a booking. Every morning there is a free breakfast in the dining room downstairs. This really is a gem of a hotel, if you're looking for a great hotel at a great price, this is the place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Old but clean, the elevator is antique, far from train station”
Reviews.Author: shuan
Reviews.Content: This hotel building is very old, it has a very old elevator which you need to open the door manually. The door is very heavy and very difficult to open. However, we felt that is the unique of this hotel. The hotel is old even their bedsheet. Their bedsheet had been worm out but other than that the whole room is clean and spacious. The room was very simple furnished. This hotel is a distant from the train station ( train from airport) especially when you are carry heavy luggage uphill. Overall, this is a simple small budget hotel, worth the value.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for last minute plans”
Reviews.Author: greenjeep999
Reviews.Content: We decided to take a trip to SF last minute, and found a great deal here. We stayed on the 6th floor, great view of the city. Rooms are a little small, but since we spent most of our time out and about, it was perfect! If you're looking for a centrally located hotel, this is your best bet.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kevin K
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a fancy hotel with all the bells and whistles, you won't find it here. If you're looking a great hotel in a great location for low cost, then this might be the best hotel out there. We stayed here for a week and enjoyed every minute of it. Our room was clean and comfortable with two huge closets. I would describe the decor as old world charm and the room definitely shows its age but everything is functional. The hotel looks great because it's been well cared for. The free continental breakfast is a huge plus therefore we ate it almost every day and it was superb. The wifi in our room was hit and miss because it worked on my laptop but not my cellphone or ipod. We wanted a hotel close to chinatown and this hotel was perfect. We walked to chinatown and to union square a lot since it was so close. If we were to travel to San Francisco again, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Brucie619
Reviews.Content: The price was great. This hotel was near everything. We walked to Chinatown, Union Square, Fisherman's Wharf, Golden Gate Park. They had underground parking which was super tight (must have small vehicle) but it was free. Hester at the front desk was so nice. She was so pleasant and helpful. It feels more like a B&B. The room was small and older but clean, I felt like I was staying at an apartment not a hotel. A lot of closet space! The breakfast was simple, just pastries and coffee. The orange juice was fresh and delicious and you could smell them baking the cookies the night before. We really enjoyed out stay here. We will be back. Any negatives? Not really.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and charming”
Reviews.Author: warriorbard
Reviews.Content: I love the fact that the hotel keeps a low profile; it keeps its atmosphere quaint and charming. The hotel's decor is not modern but that adds to its charm. It has sort of an old school European feel to it, especially with its old fashioned elevators. The hotel is also tastefully decorated with murals on the walls, hallways and doors. The hotel's location is excellent; it's just a short walk to the cable cars, Union Square, Chinatown and Powell Station. It's also a quiet area with a corner store right next door and a laundromat just a few stores down. If you're looking for convenience without being smack in the middle of the hustle and bustle, this is the hotel for you. The rooms are fantastic; I simply ADORE the two walk in closets provided in my room. So much storage space helped kept the room clutter free. The beds are comfortable and warm. The mini kitchenette was a nice bonus; there's a fridge, a microwave, sink, plates and cutlery. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room rates include a continental breakfast which are basically assorted pastries, tea coffee, juice and hot chocolate. I suppose eating only cookies, muffins and bread can get quite tedious if you've an extended stay but again, the hotel's location allows for one to simply find breakfast elsewhere. Overall, I would really recommend this hotel. It's in a good, safe location, the price doesn't stress one's budget and the rooms are airy with plenty of space.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect. Location, parking, price!”
Reviews.Author: t_carBuffalo_Ny
Reviews.Content: Loved it. First off, they don't guarantee parking, but if you come during the weekend there is free street parking right next to them. We were able to snag one of their spots but only a compact car fits through the entrance. It is very close to a the cable car - which will take you to the train. We left our car in the parking garage and never used it! $90 a night? Yes its true. The rooms were a little small, yes, but who is ever in their rooms when they are visiting san francisco? They were clean, quiet, and had a refrigerator for leftovers and snacks. Breakfast was decent. A nice continental. We had a hardboiled egg, muffin, oatmeal with fruit, and some toast with nutella everyday! Overall, the perfect place for us.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we stayed at during our entire trip!”
Reviews.Author: travellinman2112
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel, and fabulous people on the reception too! We stayed four nights, and as tourists were very happy with both the hotel position and the room. We are a family of four so the "double double" was great value (for SF) for us and we all loved it. Breakfast was free and the room included a fridge and microwave so plenty of opportunity to economise on meals if necessary. The room was old but well maintained. Reception staff were terrific and really took their time to help us make the right choices during our stay. Za Pizza is easy walking distance and is right next to Swensen's ice cream (closed on Mondays) - both well worth the walk. You'll pass both if you walk from the hotel along Hyde Street to the crooked Lombard Street that you heard so much about.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean affordable hotel in city center”
Reviews.Author: DaanWouters
Reviews.Content: Mayflower is not an modern hotel but is has charm and it is tidy and clean. Our room was quiet, clean and had a small kitchenette. Breakfast is more than fine to American standards, There are two computers for travellers who didn't bring their laptop and want to check their mails. It has an elevator. People at reception were very friendly and helpful. And it is in the center of San Francisco. Compared to other hotels in the city center, Mayflower is really a bargain and offers great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: Chris-Peg
Reviews.Content: This is an old style hotel. Neat upkeep. There was a little mold in the bathroom and a yellow stain in front of toilet. Otherwise value was great, 5 minutes walking from Chinatown and Union Square. Great little market next door. They had a few different things at their continental breakfast, overall good. THE BEST PART IS THAT THIS IS A GREAT VALUE FOR S.F., if you have low expectations, you'll be very happy! I accidentially stayed an extra day and they were great about it, did not charge more or get annoyed. Has an oldstyle elevator, COOL.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable stay and WIFI issues”
Reviews.Author: Suntory65
Reviews.Content: Overall quality of the hotel is not great. The standard room I stayed in is old and on the dirty side. Bedsheets, towels, and blankets are worned down. Stayed on the 4th floor and the WIFI connection comes and goes. Was only able to connect 10% of the time. Stayed over a friday night and the noise outside on the street was incredibly loud - so loud that I was woken up three times in one night with the windows shut. The only positive thing about this hotel is the friendly owners.

Reviews.Title: “Clean comfortable and very good value for union square location”
Reviews.Author: Melbournetraveller84
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights on basis of TA reviews May 11, very happy with this hotel. Had upgraded 'queen' room which worth it, very good value for central SFO, where alternative is to pay nearly double for modern hotel soulless room. Didnt see standard rooms but our facilities were as per hotel web site, quiet comfortable room where we were able to fully recover from jetlag. View of city not very scenic but much better than a ventilation shaft/light well which has been our experience elsewhere. Room had ceiling fan, cant remember if there is any aircon, but opening windows are a bonus in our view. Hotel and rooms are well used but interesting (murals on walls), pretty basic furnishings but all spotless. Staff very helpful but sometimes busy, unsurprising in a small hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: lil_gala
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were very pleasantly surprised by our 4-day stay at the Mayflower. The room was very spacious (kitchenette, 2 walk in closets, a desk and 2 beds) and the staff was very friendly. Breakfast is basic, but has excellent baked goods and apples. While this isn't a fancy hotel, it has it's charms (old fashioned elevator) and is clean. My only complaint is that the wifi connection was nil to non-existent most of the time. But even still - it's a really good bargain hotel in the centre of San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Decent price.”
Reviews.Author: radionus
Reviews.Content: Stopped here on my travels up the coast with my kids. Hotels are quite pricey this time of year, buy we got a decent deal here. The staff was some what rude, and void of emotion. But, the rooms were clean, and while it was out of the way it wasn't too bad. I recommend this for quick travelers on the go.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, friendly staff, free wireless internet”
Reviews.Author: netbits
Reviews.Content: I managed to choose the Bay to Breaker's weekend to stay in San Fran. All of Union Square seemed to be booked out. I was lucky to find a place sleep, and doubly lucky to stay at the Mayflower. Staff were friendly, rooms very clean - bed made and new towels each day. TV. Heater was adjustable. Mayflower market is next door, so a few deli snacks to put in the bar fridge. Also included is a continental breakfast. If you need a hairdryer or corkscrew :) they have them down at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: Faylou
Reviews.Content: My mam and I have stayed at the Hotel Mayflower twice in the last 8 months and we love it. It is such a friendly atmosphere and very much feels like being at home. The rooms are great and have everything you need. The Hotel is in a really nice area (Nob Hill) and is only a couple of blocks to Union Square (all downhill). There is a great deli next door for you to stock your fridge in the room with snacks/drinks etc. The breakfasts are just what you need for a great start to the day and the fresh baked cookies and cakes are the best (Thanks Hester). Plenty of restaurants nearby too. The owner and staff are very friendly, down to earth and extremely helpful. We will be back to San Francisco many times and we would not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for San Fran”
Reviews.Author: unclephil12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mayflower for 4 nights in early May. We asked for a more quiet room and was given room 118 on the 2nd floor at the back of the building. For the most part it was very quiet with the occational siren the only noticeable noise. It was still cool at night so turning on the baseboard heater helped. There is no A/C though. It is a "standard room" and its quite small (but clean) and basic, with a double bed, a desk and chair (plus a folding chair) and a small TV. There is a small kitchenette with a sink, microwave, small fridge, a few glasses and dishes. The bathroom is quite small but clean. There's no iron / board or hair dryer, although we got a hair dryer by asking at the front desk. It's located close to Union Square and only 2 blocks from the cable car line that takes you down to the Wharf which was very convenient as we use it quite a bit. The hotel is also a block away from the Alamo/National car rental which was super convenient. There was breakfast included each morning consisting of toast, cookies, muffins, hard boiled eggs, apples, oatmeal packets, coffee and juice. Good enough if you want to save a bit of money. The front desk people were always friendly and helpful. The free wifi was very fast with no connection problems. They had 3 computers and a printer for use free of charge which was great for printing out directions for the MUNI. The room could use some sprucing up though as some of the paint's cracked and the light bulbs above the door and at the kitchenette were just left bare. All in all, for $90 plus tax a night and considering the convenient location, good wifi and clean room, its good value.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: bluefloozy
Reviews.Content: Friendly, welcoming and excellent staff. We enjoyed our trip to San Francisco and the Mayflower was great - easy to access a range of touristy stuff. Staff helped us with using the buses and trams. Rooms are large and the breakfast - especially home made cakes was good. Kitchen facilities in room a bit limited but we managed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SunnyOkan
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at the Mayflower Hotel and we were very pleased with the location of the hotel and the clean comfortable room. We enjoyed the character of the hotel and the front desk was helpful in everything from restaurant suggestions, to directions and even change for the bus. The room was always clean and it was very handy to have a small fridge and microwave for late afternoon snacks. The closet was huge with lots of hangers and storage for bags. The breakfast gave us a good start to a busy day of touring the wonderful city of San Francisco. We would be happy to return to the Hotel Mayflower for a future trip.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, safe, great location”
Reviews.Author: Liz_pomegranate
Reviews.Content: What a lovely surprise! I took a risk booking the Hotel Mayflower solely off Internet reviews, but I'm so glad I did. The staff are friendly, the rooms very clean although old, and the location is walking distance to many areas. Breakfast is toast, coffee, juice, muffins, instant oatmeal, eggs, and apples. Simple but sufficient. Free parking, although we didn't have a car so moot point for us. Overall, this is the best choice for an inexpensive hotel in San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel for no-frills travelers”
Reviews.Author: plngp
Reviews.Content: Hotel Mayflower is a no-frills hotel that is a throwback to the glory days of the '20's. Adequate room space with lots of closets. Residential neighborhood with lots of local restaurants within walking distance. Busses to everywhere withing 5 city blocks. Wireless and hotel computers were not reliable, bring your smart phone. TV was worthless, small with broken speaker. Breakfast is good, coffee, toast and excellent cookies. For full breakfast, walk to Golden Coffee Shop at Sutter and Leavenworth. Front desk was helpful in every way, from accommodations to restaurant recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: 1005jerome
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Mayflower for 8 nights. I booked it because it said it had a "kitchenette" and I didn't want to have to eat at restaurants all the time. There was a "kitchenette", but not as I thought. No pots/pans or stove top. A microwave and half refrigerator which were fine. A few dishes and utensils but nothing to wash them with (soap or sponges). Breakfast provided is minimal, better to bring in your own. My room was not cleaned till between 3:30 - 4 pm each day, I frequently returned to the hotel and my room was still not made up. The location is good, downtown San Francisco. If you are looking for a budget hotel with no frills, this place is fine. Front desk staff is friendly and well informed. My room was quiet, but I heard another guest asking for a change in room because his room was noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Classic no frills hotel on a budget”
Reviews.Author: scoredonu
Reviews.Content: My review factors in three things 1) relatively cheap for SF, 2) its an older hotel, and 3) it was near Curran Theater. Pros Clean but shows its age it certain locations Plenty of natural light Good customer service Free breakfast Near public transportation (including cable cars) Some kitchenette Huge closet Baggage storage very nice lobby Cons Basic room, small "Queen" No drapes for windows a lot of sun light on a sunny day (as rare as that may be) Not loud but not quiet either re sound from outside. Smoking smell in hallways, not room itself Overall, I thought the hotel was of fair quality for the amount we paid 120/night. I would recommend it but as a no frill hotel with more classic features than a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base to explore SF!”
Reviews.Author: TravelBudz48
Reviews.Content: Many hours of research landed us this hotel. Decent price in an excellent location. The room was comfortable. TV, walk in wardrobe, double bed, chair and a decent bathroom. There is also a very basic kitchenette. The whole building is fairly old and this is reflective of the lift (which is slow, and has a cage door) and the decor of the room. There is free parking. However, we were driving an SUV so this would not have fitted so we parked elsewhere - this cosy about $20 per night. We didn't need the car during our stay so this was fine to just park around the corner. The location is superb - 5 mins walk to China Town and Union Square. Many Muni stops nearby too. As an extra point I would certainly recommend the 3 (or maybe 5) days pass as this is excellent value for money to just hop on and off the buses, metro, cable cars and F-line (which is a tram system). We were also comfortable to walk around during the night - the area seemed pretty safe. The breakfast is included in the room rate. It is fairly basic but just what you need. Toast, cookies, eggs, cheese. Plenty to get you up and running in the morning. We would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: WPN
Reviews.Content: What an excellent value! For $90/night, we got free parking in a LOCKED underground garage, free Internet, free breakfast, and an in-room kitchenette with a microwave, mini-fridge, and real dishes. The closet was enormous--it could have easily fit several bikes for those interested in biking through Golden Gate Park of the Presidio. The upstairs lobby has a cozy nook with an eclectic array of books and tour guides. It also has computers and a printer for boarding passes. The staff was friendly and accommodating, and even let us keep our bags and car at the hotel between checkout time and out evening departure time. **Please note that this is a very basic, no frills hotel. The beds are VERY small, and the rooms look as though they have not been renovated for a long time. Also, the street noise is loud, so bring earplugs if you are a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place, very well located”
Reviews.Author: Mendietan
Reviews.Content: It is not a fancy hotel, but it is a nice, clean, and comfortable place to stay at a good price. The location is wonderful! It is near everything but away from the hectic Union Square. The neighborhood is nice and you won't find scary people around when you go out of the place, just like fancy hotels around Union Sqare but surrrounded by prostitues, homeless and funny looking characters. The cable car station is a block away, pretty convenient. The rooms are spacy and very clean. I loved the hand painted decoration. The owners are very friendly and helpful. They even have a parking place and they won't charge extra for it, something very rare around San Francisco. I am a picky person and I like to stay at a comfortable room. I recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great basic hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: vikas248
Reviews.Content: Mayflower is a very favorably located hotel near Nob Hill and Union Square areas of SF. Access to cabs and public transport (including the famous cable car) is very easy. Plus, being near Union Square and Chinatown, one can experience many great and small restaurants around. During our trip, the hotel's lobby and dining areas were quite cold (maybe because the heating was off and the management kept the front door open). But, the room was nice, airy, and warm. The staff was extremely courteous, helpful and provided us with all the stuff that we needed during our stay in SF. There were no issues with the service. The hotel itself is quite old, 1929 I guess, but at the price, its the best deal in SF, considering the location and convenience that comes with it.

Reviews.Title: “Family run reflected by personal service”
Reviews.Author: NWIFlyer
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in the Mayflower several times over the past few years, and it would always be our first choice in San Francisco. The staff are friendly and helpful, the rooms large, and the price to location ratio excellent. The inclusive continental breakfast in the morning is almost all hand prepared rather than pre-packaged such as you'd find in a chain hotel so you never quite know what to expect, but there's always plenty to find that tastes good! The rooms also have a sink, microwave, crockery and glasses so you can bring in drinks and meals from the medium sized supermarket a couple of doors down which seems to open from early to late. There's lots of transport options close by for longer trips, but the hotel is close enough to Chinatown and Union Square to be able to walk in just a few minutes - and we've certainly never felt unsafe in the surrounding area. We'd recommend to anyone, but particularly couples who are looking for a historic hotel without paying a fortune.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, great value!”
Reviews.Author: sharksydoisters
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, friendly staff and great location. I'd stay there again in a heartbeat. Make plans for breakfast- the continental is strange and not delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: KrisT-72
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable, friendly & helpful staff, affordable. Close to Union Square. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, great location and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: cks10
Reviews.Content: The staff on the front desk are so friendly and helpful, they recommended places to eat and as we were there on our honeymoon, even left us some sparkling wine in our room which was such a nice thought. The location is great, and you can easily catch the cable cars which run right near the hotel. It has free parking and free continental breakfast. The rooms were surprisingly big with a kitchen area and huge walk in closet! We will definitely visit San Francisco and The Mayflower again!

Reviews.Title: “Superb value”
Reviews.Author: Gullible88
Reviews.Content: Brilliant value especially if you need free parking for a small or medium sized car. Friendly helpful staff. This was San Francisco's state of the art hotel in 1929 and has plenty of old world charm. I've never had such a large walk in wardrobe. Fairly basic but nice complimentary breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, you must stay here!”
Reviews.Author: birdseye
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a hidden gem that I only found via this site as it doesn't appear on expedia, bookings.com etc. The Hotel situtated not far from Union Square at the bottom of Nob Hill so is fairly quiet in comparison to the two other hotels I stayed in in SF. The rooms are huge and whilst not trendily decorated I quite liked the shabby chic feel to the room and they were clean and tidy. The hotel offered a small free breakfast with some yummy homemade cakes but slightly wierd tasting coffee. The staff were excellent and were very helpful with directions to a Baseball game I was going to and what areas to avoid! My only suggestion would be maybe a small bar for hotel guests. Its such a nice hotel it wiould be great to sit and talk to other guests with a beer or two! Highly recommended and my favourite of the 3 places I stayed in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located - afforable hotel !”
Reviews.Author: mrsguide
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conviently located with all the sites being within walking distance. We were with a group of 5 - 2 adults and 3 teenagers and booked a suite. This however was a bit small for all of us - a pity we we're advised better when I enquired at the hotel when I booked. When we arrived there was sand in the bath but I reported this to the friendly lady at the reception and when we returned it was clean. We had enough towels etc. The breakfast was good considering that it was a 2 star hotel. With toast - cereals- boiled eggs and plenty of cakes and cookies. Also a pity that my pillow smelled as if someone with a high fever had slept on it before me!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel only - wish they would have room service”
Reviews.Author: Plamenacka
Reviews.Content: Great location close to cable car station and union square 15 minutes walk to fisherman´s wharf. Rooms are reasonably big with comfortable beds. 2 closets , small "kitchen". It is not modern decor but who cares we only wanted some place with shower, bed, breakfast free wifi and great location and this is exactly it and for very reasonable rate. Small breakfast everyday only the coffee doesn´t taste too good :) As we went to bed early every day as SF is 9 hours behind "our" time we always woke up around 04:00 very hungry so I just wish they would have room service so I wouldn´t have to wait 3 hours for food :))

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel but well appointed large...”
Reviews.Author: voyger1
Reviews.Content: Small hotel but well appointed large rooms that are in need of some modernising. Free wifi in the rooms and really close for all the shops bars and china town. Great value I'd highly recommend for the price!

Reviews.Title: “A great base to explore San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Circumlocutious
Reviews.Content: This is as great as a 2 star hotel will ever get. The staff are friendly and accommodating and gave us a discount for staying 2 weeks. The family rooms have 2 double beds and plenty of space, a decent washroom with lots of towels, and a kitchenette. Breakfast is sparse, with no juices or cereals, but plenty of cakes, toast, delicious cookies, and mediocre coffee. Still, if you're staying a few days, you'll likely want a change-up. Try the market right next door. Also, the WiFi is spotty throughout the building, so don't expect a great connection in your room, if any! The location is pretty nice, in the lower parts of Nob Hill and a good distance from shady Tenderloin area. There are plenty of cafes, eateries, and laundromats around, and you can pretty much walk to most of the interesting places in the East end of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: kiwiyodel
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Mayflower hotel with three children and were very happy with the service, staff and location. Nancy and her staff were very accommodating, helpful and patient, giving us lots of information and helping us with our inquiries. The garage was challenging to say the least, but we managed to park our Dodge people mover with milimeters to spare going down the narrow garage entrance. What a bonus not having to pay for parking! Be aware though that parking spaces are limited and not guaranteed. Since we liked the place so much we booked another night upon our return to SFO and were welcomed back warmly. The Mayflower is old and many might find it dated, but it was clean, the location was great and we felt we got a really good deal for our money.

Reviews.Title: “Very homey feel!”
Reviews.Author: Summerdaizy83
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have stayed at this hotel twice already. Once in 2007 and again in 2009. We love San Francisco and can't afford to splurge on the ritzy hotels downtown (but cleanliness and location are my top priorities - I know, I'm picky!) The staff was very friendly and helpful. We dealt with Nancy and she's the owner. She was helpful and suggested the best places to go and eat. The location is good, although a fair distance from the wharf (I love walking so it took about 30 minutes) but it's within walking distance of Chinatown. If you google map the location, you will find lots of shopping within walking distance. If you like the nightlife, there are some clubs and bars nearby as well. If you plan to park your car at the hotel, be sure to take a small car....the driveway is EXTREMELY narrow. The driveway was built many years ago when cars were smaller apparently. The hotel itself is old but newly renovated. You will get varying success with the wifi within the rooms, however, there are two computers with internet located on the second floor above the lobby that are available for your use. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “No question about it.. Hotel Mayflower is a winner!”
Reviews.Author: HuggieSA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week, and fully satisified. I don't know what I expected for $90/night in a city and area with hotel average close to $200. But this one exceeded my expectations. Free wifi. Free breakfast. Free parking (small/ subcompact only). A fridge, microwave and sink in kitchenette. Large bathroom. Everything clean. Quiet. I am used to a King size bed, but the Double did just fine as it is the only size available. The location is pretty much perfect for visiting San Francisco. Next door is a grocery store in case you need water and fruits and food, etc. If you're budget minded but don't want that budget experience, the Hotel Mayflower is a winner.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of SF!”
Reviews.Author: Sony46
Reviews.Content: I had a nice and quilet stay here. Breakfast was okay. A little bit to expencive. If you are going out at night, you are at a good startingpoint. Between the financial district and theclub aera. Nice rooms, elevator, garage (might be hard to get in with big car).

Reviews.Title: “Charming, affordable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: iandade
Reviews.Content: Reception and housekeeping were good. Breakfast was enough. Room was old fashioned but clean and equipped just fine. Location was just a bit off Nob Hill, but also near enough to stray into a rough district if you weren't aware. Wifi worked well. Plan your trips out so that you ride the California Street cable car back...no hills to climb. For a quiet room get one to the side of the hotel....no view but less street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in SF”
Reviews.Author: Kisak
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in Mayflower. The hotel is in the center of SF, close to ChinaTown and UnionSquare. The rooms are clean and staff is nice and helpful. Simple breakfast was included but it was enough to make us full for the first part of the day. Once you are in SF try Kara's cupacakes on Ghirardelli Square - they are the best cupcakes I have ever had!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location; great value; great staff”
Reviews.Author: twinkly
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel, in what I assume is a period property, as I doubt they'd build a hotel like that these days. Free wifi in the rooms, although reception can be poor in some areas - you may want to check when you book, as some rooms are better than others. The room was nice, clean, with a good sized bathroom, and fridge. The front desk staff were really helpful, and gave us help and advice on visits, etc. Top tip; ask for a room on the quiet side of the hotel - despite the double glazing, the street outside can be surprisingly noisy at night.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely welcoming hotel with comfortable clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: ColindaLondon
Reviews.Content: Very welcoming hosts in an old building fully refurbished to a high and simple standard. The room was spotless, quiet and comfortable. One weakness was the breakfast. Best to skip it.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Accommodating Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sharonious99
Reviews.Content: My son moved up to San Francisco for a job and didn't have a place to stay. It is not easy finding a roommate to live with so it took him some time to find a suitable living situation. The Mayflower was so understanding about his situation and made it easy to live at the hotel until he was able to find a new home. The location is great, the rooms are nice and clean. Thanks Mayflower!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel in the middle of the city.”
Reviews.Author: amoviaggo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mayflower with our 11-year-old grandson. The rooms are clean, comfortable, and the price is great. The location is perfect for walking to almost everyplace in the city. Buses are convenient to the location too. The staff is fabulous. Our grandson left his new wireless mouse there. I called, they found it and are mailing it back to us. That is fantastic service. I'll stay there on every trip.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Time Even Better Than The First”
Reviews.Author: nipples
Reviews.Content: Came up to visit friends and do Sharkfest swim a second time. The hotel staff knew that there were a few athletes staying at the hotel for this and another event and put the tasty continental breakfast out 2 hours earlier than normal to accomodate them..That is just one thing that makes this place a worthwile place to stay; great customer service. The price is right and location good too.They also have computers you may use free of charge. Am sure will back a third time as well

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: mtlgirl_7
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights at the Mayflower and I really liked my stay. For such a low price, you get a confortable room, free breakfast, and free Internet. The room was well equiped with a frige, a microwave, a sink, dishes and a TV. The location is great and your about 25 walks to downtown San Francisco and the bay. I would highly recommend it to everybody!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Little Surprise”
Reviews.Author: beckybuffaloNy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the mayflower for two nights, not our original reservation but after a chance meeting with the owner in a restaurant in Carmel, we gave it a shot. We lucked out as it was located in Nob Hill, close to China Town and great shopping. The Hotel itself is in an old building with a small charming old style elevator. Wood work throughout is gorgeous. Our room is what we wanted, very clean with the basics. We are here to see the city, not spend a whole lot of time in the room. Continental breakfast served in the morning was a bonus as well as parking below the Hotel a convenience much appreciated. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful with any of our needs. The first floor was equipped with Computers, printer and an areas to just sit and relax. It was nice as we had alot of time before we had to head to the airport. I highly recommend this Hotel if you are looking for a hidden gem of value, location, and great service. Thanks to all the staff and especially Nick who helped us with getting the room. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “good value, great room”
Reviews.Author: seventhandmain
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and liked the large room with kitchette and huge closet. You could practically live here. Some decent period details too, not added recently in a kitschy way but original to the building. This is not a place from someone who wants luxury and the latest conveniences.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable solution, but not for luxury seekers”
Reviews.Author: QuquMoscow
Reviews.Content: Stayed with two kids in Dec 2009. Evrth. is clean. No luxury. Superb breakfast. Great location (almost downtown). Clean linen. Wi-Fi worked great. Very friendly and helpful staff. The building is very old and "shabby", but this makes almost no influence on rooms. Our kitchenette had no stove, only a microwave. Excellent price/value solution.

Reviews.Title: “it's all good”
Reviews.Author: spal123
Reviews.Content: Good location, few blocks easy walk from downtown. Good price for location. Good advice from reception on restaurants, bike hire, trams, etc. Rooms are big because the building is old - this is a good thing if you like having a walk-in wardrobe, a big chest of drawers, a table and chairs, a kitchenette, a bath and lots of space... Amazing customer service, I stupidly left some valuables and personal belongings behind and they posted them to the UK for me!

Reviews.Title: “I think i would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: josh_132
Reviews.Content: I was curious to see what everyone else meant by "outdated". I realised what that was: the carpet was old and the paintings on the walls reminded me of older times. But Mayflwer was quite nice overall. It was centrally located, and had an impressive entrance. The rooms were indeed old but well maintained. I think the 'age' of the hotel was a definite plus! My girlfriend was happy (which is the whole point right?) There were a couple of PCs available with free internet. Plus, pricing was pretty good. On the downside, we could hear a bit of noise from the window, so try to get one of the top rooms. We had to pick a 'smoker's room' and we could still smell the cigarettes (wich is fine if you're a smoker, although we were not). Also breakfast was crap, so you may avoid it. Overall, I would certainly stay again, as long as they give me a room in the top floors and provided that a non-smoker's room is free.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Doreen8
Reviews.Content: This was a good hotel, fairly central location. A large room which had a fridge and microwave in it which was very handy. The breakfast was sufficient with plenty of choice. The bed was clean and comfortable. The staff were extrememly helpful and I would recommnd this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value with fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: keithhoskins
Reviews.Content: The Mayflower Hotel was an excellent choice. We arrived at the Maflower after a long flight from Sydney Australia. We were greated by the hotel reception staff who went out of their way to ensure all our needs were met. The family room we had booked was very clean and very comfortable including the beds. Nancy the owner went out of her way to assist us purchase some family tickets to see the San Francisco 49ers. We could not purchase these tickets in Australia and Nancy helped us out and even followed up after the game to see whether we had a good time. The Mayflower met all our needs in every way, a great location, excellent hotel staff and a very comfortable room. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are on a budget and after clean and safe place in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel, nothing fancy”
Reviews.Author: skitty811
Reviews.Content: Hotel Mayflower is a great choice if you are traveling on a budget and want to be close to the center of San Francisco. There is not much going on on the street itself, but it is a short walk to Nob Hill, Chinatown, Union Square and all of the public transportation. Booking the hotel was very easy, as was check in, etc - and the price really couldn't be beat - especially in San Francisco where there are so many expensive hotels. I saw two rooms - both were very spacious, clean, but a little run down (which is fine for me) - the only complaint I have is that the hotel smelled a bit musty, or overly like cleaning products, but I opened my window and it was fine. I also wanted to change rooms when I got there and the manager was very accommodating and moved other people around so I would feel comfortable. A big plus of this hotel is the continental breakfast which is included. It has the usual - toast, coffee, tea - but also everyday there was some fresh home-made baked goods that were delicious - coffee cake, pecan cake, lemon poppy-seed bread, cookies, muffins. That was a lovely touch. Also, Free Wifi! This is really a great choice, just don't expect anything too fancy.

Reviews.Title: “My place to stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: allohaa1
Reviews.Content: Very good price for San Francisco. The staff of the hotel is very nice and always happy to help you with anything: they suggest good restaurant and give advice for things to see/visit. You have a good breakfast with toast, muffin, coffee, juice, fruits etc. and a free access to Internet and computers. Rooms are clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good... for the price”
Reviews.Author: Grizzly78
Reviews.Content: There was nothing very outstanding about our room, which looked like it was last redecorated in about 1970, or indedd about the broadband internet which (though free) was very patchy. But for $100 a night, in the centre of SFO, you can't very well complain.

Reviews.Title: “We were surprised and thrilled - best value for SF”
Reviews.Author: trav1a
Reviews.Content: Our daughter is a student at AAU & we had to help find her an apartment. We checked many hotels & rates before choosing the Mayflower, mostly for price, the highest recommend rate & central location. We arrived early morning & they gave us a room anyway, stayed 2 days & extended over the weekend, then another day while waiting for the rent application. It was absolutely wonderful; family owned, great (and helpful) staff, ample parking (but VERY narrow access), a small free breakfast every day got us on our way, spacious and comfortable rooms and beds, a small kitchen area and a clean bathroom!, etc. made this the best value for the price. They even change towels & sheets every day. Our only minor problem was a squeaky ceiling fan (even forgot to tell them at checkout). There is a small store next door (convenient for groceries), and many pubs, pizza and other restaurants, sandwich shops, coffee houses, etc nearby, the bus stops around the corner, cable car a few blocks over, very close to everything. This was a diamond-in-the-rough, a blessing to come back to after walking all over SF looking for apartments every day!! We can't understand how they would ever get a bad review, but we definitely recommend and look forward to staying there again. p.s. I happened to call their number direct to ask about the parking and got THEIR rate which was less! (i.e. don't book them online and save your money)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service and good location”
Reviews.Author: JJ29NL
Reviews.Content: Family of 5 from The Netherlands; We stayed 2 nights in The Mayflower Hotel with an excellent breakfast, serving everything you need before exploring San Francisco. The building is old but still in good condition and has its own charm. The rooms are clean and reasonable sized. The traffic noise is very limited in the rooms. When checking in we already found out the staff was very helpful with a basic city-map to find the way outside, to assist with bus-lines and stopping times and much more. This is a place to feel relaxed while nearby attractive places in the city. We wished to stay longer to see more of this interesting city. We recommend this place to other visitors!

Reviews.Title: “Bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: easNewYork
Reviews.Content: Not the most fancy hotel but very quaint! It has an older feel but I would not call it outdated. Breakfast was good and location was great. Don't spend extra for a "city view", there was not much of one.

Reviews.Title: “older style but very nice”
Reviews.Author: danyuls
Reviews.Content: When you first walk in you can see the character of the hotel. The front desk lady was very friendly and let us check in early around 7ish. The elevators are the old style with folding cage and hinged doors... very small space. The room is not up to date but clean. There is a microwave, sink, fridge, plates, coffee mugs, and utensils, and a large walk in closet. The breakfast was simple, self serve, and free... coffee, hot chocolate, toast, muffins, oatmeal, peanut butter jelly. 7-10am i think. We walked to union square everyday which was about 3 to 4 blocks... and hilly. From there you can catch most transport. Or there are many bus lines that go near the hotel. The area seemed safe... we walked a lot and never had any trouble. They say not to go into tenderloin which is nearby. If you dont like car noise then ask for the other side. We stayed on the street side and could hear cars but not so much that i minded.

Reviews.Title: “Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrStraightTalker
Reviews.Content: I am recently back from a month of solo-travelling in California. The Mayflower Hotel was my favourite accommodation that I used during this visit. As I was using public transport, location was an essential factor when choosing accommodation. Mayflower is a 15-minute (slightly uphill) walk from the Greyhound bus station. It is only a 5-minute walk from the Powell Street cable car. The hotel staff were very friendly throughout and helped me solve two problems. Firstly, my mobile charger (from the UK) was faulty, but I was quickkly supplied with an American one that had been left behind by another guest. Secondly, I was finding it difficult to upload photos on one of the three available computers. A computer technician was soon called and a solution found! Such help and support made me feel very welccome, so much so that I booked a further night. The hotel is kept in good condition. Breakfast is basic but better than you will find in other places. Overall, this hotel is a gem and well worth booking.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Muscadine
Reviews.Content: Stayed for almost a week with partner in this downtown hotel while doing research, attending a conference, and doing some sightseeing. Cost and location were big influences in making the reservation. We expected something "decent," but for the most part it was a pleasant surprise. The staff were incredibly helpful at check-in and throughout the stay, giving tips about the surrounding area including where to park for cheap (the hotel does have some limited parking of its own but there is a fee). Our hotel room was on the top floor, facing the next-door residential building so not exactly a room with a view (unless you're a voyeur) but the windows were screened and a nice breeze came through with them open. There was some noise from people living in the other building (and perhaps other hotel rooms with open windows) but not disturbingly loud - we had no problems sleeping. The building/rooms are old but partially remodeled - nice carpet and tile, LOTS of closet space, spacious bathroom, kitchenette area with microwave and minifridge. Quaint murals throughout the hotel, including in the rooms (rooms are named based on landmarks in the city, with a matching mural in the room). We had a "deluxe queen" room which was quite spacious with a small seating area, desk, and TV armoire. The rooms are not AC climate controlled (not unusual in SF) but with the fan and open windows we were quite comfortable (and there was a warm spell while there). Neither of us were impressed with the continental breakfast - mostly carbs and nothing mouthwatering. We had problems with the wireless internet not being available the first morning but after speaking with the front desk it was fixed and no further problems during the trip. The hotel is convenient to most of the downtown area and many public transportation options. It is a bit of a hike to the fisherman's wharf area but we did walk it one day and it was pleasant (though we rode back on the trolley). The front desk did point out to us when we checked in that the tenderloin area is somewhat nearby and what areas to avoid - we had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel with family spirit”
Reviews.Author: El_Danes
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely situated dowh town SF. We stayed for 4 nights and from the beginning to end we felt the hotel family spirit. Especially the home made cake for breakfast had a special personal touch. No industrial hotel food here. Free access to 4 Internet pc's was a strong asset.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel no negatives whatsoever”
Reviews.Author: bridan90
Reviews.Content: Great hotel really enjoyed our short stay there. We had the suite and it was very nice decorated and very clean. Staff were lovely and extremely helpful.
