Would recommend it to anyone. Very central and very handy for shopping. There's a small grocery store right next door to the hotel and all the bigger shops are within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best kept secret in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Ausman46
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mayflower two years ago travelling back to Asutralia from Canada. So it was a 'no brainer' to stay there again this year, with my wife and daughter. Great staff - great location - great value. Do yourself a favour - when in San Francisco, stay at the Mayflower.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel -- Parking is Mr. Toad's Wild Ride”
Reviews.Author: mvdljca
Reviews.Content: The Mayflower is a throwback to a time most of us don't remember; when a hotel was a nice place to stay, not part of the 'HOSPITALITY INDUSTRY." It's a wonderful, quaint old hotel that's very clean and in excellent repair, with friendly people who are more than willing to accommodate. I stayed here while touring colleges with my 17-year-old daughter and she loved it. There's a little market next door if you need to pick up some snacks or refreshments. Location is great -- we walked to Fisherman's Wharf (through Chinatown) and back, but it's a whopper of a hill and I don't recommend it unless you're out of shape. The garage is right out of an "Untouchables" episode...I dare you to pull in there in anything larger than a rental "compact" car. I was suspicious of the 1920s plumbing, but when I fired a pipe-jammer down the hatch, it disappeared no-questions-asked. Enjoy a great breakfast at Sears just a few blocks away. Stay at the Mayflower, you'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, character and very clean”
Reviews.Author: dreamtrip1969
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this hotel. It was clean, comfortable and very close to all the action. It was also v handy to have free internet located on a very nice balcony above reception. It was an old hotel but i didn't mind. The only true gripe i had with the hotel was the manner of one of the receptionists which was 'cool' and fairly non-communicative but i was probably a bit grumpy myself having travelled for the last 24 hours previous!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff and wonderful ambience”
Reviews.Author: travelingmummy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old but has been preserved well and retains much of its original character. It is not one of those large hotels that make you feel like just another faceless guest and it is built in such way that there is a more homely, personable aspect. The hotel is nowhere near the Tenderloin so you don't have to worry about panhandlers harassing your family for change. It's located near Chinatown and we enjoyed the walk there. I can't comment on public transport because we drove to the other locations but if you drive a compact car with side mirrors that can be folded in, you can park in their garage for free. If you have a bigger vehicle, you have to park it at a nearby garage for a fee. I did a thorough search on tripadvisor for hotels as we were travelling with a 10 month old and I needed a microwave and a refrigerator and this was only one of two hotels in downtown San Francisco listed on tripadvisor that provided both. They also provide plates and utensils and cups. An earlier review commented on the bathroom tiles but I didn't notice anything wrong with their bathrooms. Because the room and bathroom are very, very clean, I was fine with letting my baby crawl all over the carpet and bathing her in the bath tub. We requested for a room on the quiet side and it was really quiet. The service was also impeccable. I had informed them earlier about needing a crib and Esther had both a pack and play and a toddler bed ready for me to choose from. The next morning, when we entered the dining hall for breakfast, the high chair (a very nice one!) was already there ready for us to use. What I like most about this hotel is that the staff clearly take pride in what they do and pay attention to details to the extent of providing sweets at the front desk for their guests which is just what you need after a long day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Real Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Gemini2656
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Mayflower from 1-3 April with my 17 yr old daughter. One of the oldest hotels in SF, the hotel has real character and a truly magnificent lobby as you enter. If you want 4-5 star this may not be the place for you, but if, like me, you prefer hotels with some "local" character and none of the anonymity of the big chains, this is the place for you. Fantastically friendly and helpful staff who are more than willing to help out with maps, hairdryers, cork screws, etc. etc. at no extra charge. Free Internet on the gallery overlooking the fabulous lobby also a nice touch. Rooms and bathroom facilities obviously old, but well renovated and clean and, once again, full of character and hugely comfortable beds. :o) In keeping with a tip on Tripadvisor, I asked for a room at the back and it was wonderfully quiet and peaceful. Rooms include small kitchenette with fridge and microwave. Breakfast is included (rare in US !) - very basic but everything you need, particularly yummy home-baked cookies and cake :o). I took taxi from airport and after getting stuck in traffic paid $60 for the luxury. Had I realised how close the BART was (4 relatively close by) I could have saved a fortune. And if you have a load of luggage, you can still grab a cab from the BART station for a couple of dollars. 4-5 minutes walk to Union square and the famous cable car line, this place is in a great location. Had a great meal about 50 yards down the road on the other side of the road at "Cafe Mozart" where they do a nice "light supper". Supermarket super convenient directly next door with ATM. I can't recommend this place enough - GREAT value for money, GREAT location and GREAT staff. Will definitely be my port of call if I find myself in SF again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here”
Reviews.Author: lj3650
Reviews.Content: My 90 yr old mother were visiting San Francisco to see the play "Wicked" at the Orphium theatre. We spent the night at the Hotel Mayflower. We chose this Hotel based on location and Trip advisor reviews. We couldn't have made a better choice. The location was central and not scarey after dark. The room was spacious including a sink, counter, microwave, and mini fridge. There was a table with two chairs. The bathroom had a full bathtub. The beds were firm, the bedding and pillows were comfortable. Our room (517) was quiet, hardly any street noise. The staff was polite and helpful. A local restaurant "Uncle Vinney's" will deliver food to your room. There was a nice dining room breakfast area. The breakfast was included and offered bakery type pastries, toasted breads, cheese, fruit, tea, coffee, milk and juice. There is a nice grocery store/deli right next door. We found it easy to hail a taxi, or the desk will call one for you. It was historic, and beautiful. Built in 1929 it was clean and in good shape. Definately stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A great value hotel in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: micned
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mayflower for 5 nights in March and had a wonderful time. The location is perfect only a 10 minute walk from the heart of things. The room was large, roomy and clean. Our room was located on the 5th floor so little traffic noise was heard. Staff friendly, polite and very helpful. I loved San Francisco and loved my time at the Mayflower and would love to return and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little gem”
Reviews.Author: holidazeroad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in January 2009. This place is great and I would recommend it to others. The staff are really helpful, breakfast good, rooms nice (a little older) and the big bonus, free internet. There's a great little deli next door if you need a few supplies or some nice sandwiches made up, also 2 coin laundries really close. There's also a nice little Italian place down the road a little for tea. If you're after somewhere that's central and well priced then this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Classic rooms with a friendly staff, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: JOCKYBOX
Reviews.Content: I had a stay for several weeks at the Mayflower. Cost and location were my deciding factors. My first room was overlooking Bush street. LOTS of sun, light, people watching - I loved it. I was not dissapointed and was pleasantly surprised with the easy feel of the place. Regarding the bathrooms (and kitchens) - they are old but the owners seem to be retaining a lot of the original feel of the original features. There are original porcelain floor and wall tiles and design details in many instances from many many years ago. When they have had to cut into a wall to modernize, I noticed someone paid a lot of attention to carefully matching modern tiles and grout such that the average person may not notice. In my opinion, this kind of bathroom is more interesting than what you would find in any modern hotel. I like to see the patina of wear and appreciate the fine craftsmanship that set all those little porcelain tiles so many years ago. Cleanliness was not an issue. I found the rooms very clean and of good size. The street side room became quite an issue by the third day as at night the street noise started to bug me. (they have to retain the old originial windows on the facade) On the third night I requested a quieter room which they showed me to in the back of the hotel. It was great - until they started remodeling the room next door. No matter - they offered to change my room again but I declined as I was out in the city during most the day. Otherwise this room near the back was very quiet at night. Someone made homemade goodies for breakfast too. In addition the the regular cereal, bread and such, cookies appeared some days and breakfast cakes on others. Gotta try the cinnimon bread toast with butter - yum. The clientele in the morning was a nice mix of Americans, some foreign travellers, and some retired folks. There was a small kitchen with mirowave & refrigerator in my room. It had minimal items to make lunch and a simple supper. There is a great market right downstairs and to the left with groceries and some prepared items. A medditerranean flair to the food and they stocked Champagne too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Monterey_CATraveler
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed at The Mayflower last weekend on the recommendation of a friend. Check in was a breeze. When we got to our 6th floor room, which was on the sunny side of the building, it was quite warm. We called the desk to see what could be done. No problem...the manager (who is also the owner's daughter) met us on the 6th floor, and escorted us to a much more comfortable room on the opposite side of the building. Personal service like this is quite rare these days. The rest of the weekend was comparable, with consistently above expectations service. Our room was spotless, comfortable and quiet. We would recommend The Mayflower to all travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Mayflower: felt comfortable, good service, very clean, lovely history”
Reviews.Author: paint_travel_
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Mayflower for 3 nights starting October 23, 2008 and found the reviews in Traveladvisor helpful in gauging my expectations. I was very happy with this hotel. After reading the reviews, my expectation was that the Hotel Mayflower would be an older hotel with the feel of a bed and breakfast. As I entered, I was impressed with the comfortable, friendly and personable assistance and greetings provide as I checked in and throughout my stay. Hester (front desk) is amazing but all the managers made every effort to be as helpful as possible. The room I stayed in, their 'standard', was roomy and felt extremely clean at an unbelievable price for a mid-city hotel. I had a friend visit me during my stay who went so far as to check for dust on top of some of the pipes visible in the hallway-no dust-we were impressed. Hotel Mayflower opened in 1929, but it wears it age well. The bed and pillows were very comfortable and the towels clean and more plush than expected even with the raves from tripadvisor reviews. The kitchenette area, also clean and usefully appointed included provided cutlery, plates mugs, and glasses. The tub in my bathroom was deep, and all was extremely clean to the eye and touch. The walk in closet was immense; about 6 feet deep and 4 feet wide-smelling slightly musty but not prohibitively. I was surprised. I loved the features in the room that spoke to the hotel's early days, the old no longer used gaslight features on the wall, the parquet floor in the bathroom, and the arched entry from the bedroom towards the door and bathroom. The sense of a well loved and cared for hotel also is evident in the decor of the lobby and the ceiling of the lobby. Check out the elevator, which is older-style lift, I especially liked how quiet it was, no blaring beeps. Other reviews made comments about things like grout on the tub that had some minor cracking--yes, I saw it too but I have seen less than perfect grout in many of the more modern hotels I have stayed in (Hyatts included) with that problem. The continental breakfast was satisfying. I was able to make toast with a variety of toppings, and either cheese or hard boiled eggs were available for those who want more protein. The coffee was hearty and the orange juice was good (definitely not from concentrate). I especially liked that there was a baked extra, like oatmeal raisin cookies, or muffins. The food is laid out in a room furnished with simpler tables and chairs but there was a plasma television and again, the place felt friendly. The neighborhood was quiet and absolutely no problem, about two blocks from the bustle of Union Square and very close to many forms of public transportation. The room was quiet, I had my windows and fan whirring constantly because I was there during the warmer fall weather and found the arrangement comfortable. The need to open windows might be a concern for those folks who have small energetic children and they should ask questions about window height if you stay during warm weather. Just as a note to those inclined to be surprised by no air conditioning: the lack of air conditioning is common for older hotels in SF. You want air conditioning at these prices, go to a Travellodge, or pay more and go to the more modern and expensive hotels. You lose something though; it is older hotels that give a visitor a sense of place and history. I like that. If I had a laptop the internet access would have been free. I was able to use computers availible to guests. I did not use a car during my stay so I cannot speak to the parking that the Mayflower provides. I wish I had pics of the murals on every floor of the staircase or the elevator. The ones attached a few views of the room, the lobby, and the guest sitting area. I felt completely at home during my stay there and would happily return.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected stay”
Reviews.Author: hichic1
Reviews.Content: We arrived before noon and they were able to check us in early as the rooms were ready. (I need to add that the check-out time is 1pm,not the usual 11am) The location, supermarket and spacious room (with microwave and fridge) was a good bargain. We had no trouble with the area's security and felt safe in the neighbourhood at night. Breakfast was good. We were not expecting much from "free continental breakfast" - maybe some juice, toasted bread/bagels and coffee, but the spread was a nice surprise, with cakes, cereals, etc. The hotel comes with a caged lift and it gives us a quaint, homely feel to this hotel. This is a family-run hotel and they have certainly made my stay homely!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: LetsBeHonest
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Mayflower is perfectly situated in an area of San Francisco that is close to many of the best tourist attractions--Union Square, Moscone Center, Nob Hill, Fishermans Wharf, Chinatown, and Japantown. We actually walked to all these places, and the walks were both invigorating and surprisingly short. Take the Hyde Street cable car back from Fishermans Wharf to the hotel. It drops you off only two blocks away at Powell & Bush. Service at the hotel was excellent. The owners are very friendly and accommodating. The room was certainly big enough and had THREE large closets. Yes, the rooms smell a bit musty, but there's no mold. And the inner rooms shelter you quite a bit from the street noise. As for the garage...the entrance is tight and getting into it should be done from a traffic lane, NOT from the parking area right in front of the hotel. Your car should be no bigger than a Toyota Matrix or Pontiac Vibe--otherwise it will scrape against the walls of the entrance. Once inside the garage, however, you have plenty of maneuvering room. And there are In & Out privileges!

Reviews.Title: “nice room & breakfast, good position, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: pepeCar
Reviews.Content: I've been there for 4 nights; I was on my own. The experience has been definetively positive. Nice and very large room & bath; Clean; wi-fi + 4 PCs connected to the internet, to be used for free; breakfast is ok; the position is very convenient, as you have union square, chinatown and the cable car, all at a walking distance. -The neighborhoods are ok, even during night. The staff is friendly. Cons -The building shows its age in some things (old lift, windows). Avoid however the area of Tenderloin, at about 10 mins walking from the hotel (the area is between Market St and Larkin St to the south, Geary St and Larkin St to the northwest), as you will find there many beggers and many not-so-nice faces :-)

Reviews.Title: “a flower”
Reviews.Author: shonm
Reviews.Content: an old renovated building. nice room, nice breakfast, nice price. good location.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel choice”
Reviews.Author: neilatk
Reviews.Content: Staff were friendly and welcoming. The rooms I stayed in were were clean and very spacious. Would book a room there again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “UNBELIEVABLE towels”
Reviews.Author: JinxyKat
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews of the Mayflower we decided to book ourselves in and save some money (we had originally contacted the Hol Inn Fishermans Wharf about staying there) - we ended up paying just over half the amount of the Hol Inn and glad in our hotel choice! The Mayflower is located just a few blocks from Union Square (5 minute walk) so is ideally situated to all the action. Rooms are superb, with a good sized main area, a small kitchen, and a nicely proportioned bathroom. We didnt really use the kitchen apart from the fridge to keep drinks cool, but if you were staying here and wanted to cook yourself, you would have no problems there! The free internet access is great and the free continental breakfast was a nice touch - sets you up for the day The thing that will live in my mind forever about this hotel though will be the towels! I have never smelt better towels! I (along with the other 3 members of our party) actually looked forward to having showers so we could get to use the fresh towels that had been laid out - we should have swiped some of the fabric conditioner and brought it home with us! I would have no hesitation in staying here again, as the location is good, the staff extremely friendly and helpful, and most importantly, the price is very very good value!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Tinman007
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant stay in the Mayflower. Rooms were spacious and clean. Staff were friendly espeically Hester at reception. Very well located as is close to Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “A San Francisco Treasure”
Reviews.Author: CivilLiberties
Reviews.Content: Hotel Mayflower is a San Francisco treasure. It is comfortable, affordable, clean, very conveniently located, and with outstanding customer service. I extended my stay from a couple of nights to a couple of months for business purposes, and loved the spacious room (brand-new mattresses), fully equipped kitchenette, spotless bathroom and professional and friendly staff. This historic hotel is perfect for both business (free internet access and separate study on first floor mezzanine) and pleasure, with Union Square shopping, theaters, restaurants and public transport within short walking distance. The complimentary breakfast is served in a beautiful airy dining room, where I felt equally welcome to read the newspaper alone or chat with the other guests. I would especially recommend the Mayflower to travellers from abroad (like myself) who wish to have convenient access to everything this city has to offer and to stay in a hotel that reflects the history of the city while providing the comforts of today. This is a family owned hotel, evident from the careful maintenance of the building (new wiring, plumbing, windows and fresh paint when I was there). It is also evident from the consideration they show their guests. They accommodated any request and did everything they could to make my stay there successful and pleasurable. I have visited the city repeatedly over the past twenty years, and this is by far my favourite place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint but familiar...”
Reviews.Author: chankagirl
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at this hotel in Oct 2006 and when I was returning to SF last month called to make reservations.No single or standard rooms were available so I was only able to get a room with a queen size bed for about 125.00 plus taxes a night. I arrived at the hotel around 1:45pm although check-in was at 3:00pm. The check-in process was quick and easy and I was able to leave my bag in the luggage room while I went to get something to eat. When I returned a few hours later, the room was ready and I was pleased. The room was clean and bright, had a kitchenette with a fridge ( which I made use of ), a microwave, glasses, mugs , cereal bowls and cutlery. The bathroom, although old, was clean, with sweet -smelling towels and fresh toiletries. During my stay I partook of the continental breakfast which consisted of orange juice, tea and coffee,butter, peanut butter, apple sauce, apples, cake, and a choice of multi-grain bread or white bread. It was self-service so you could eat as much or as little as you wanted. The breakfast was filling and a great money saver. The location is within walking distance to shopping, restaurants,and the cable cars.There is also a coin laundry nearby and a food mart next door. There was internet access in the room I stayed in as well as 3 computers for guests use, in the upstairs lobby area. The staff is friendly and helpful without being intrusive. Overall I enjoyed staying in the Mayflower Hotel and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: gaararules
Reviews.Content: Great Staff too! At first I was afraid this would be close to the tenderloin district. It's Nowhere close to tenderloin... it's far far away. It's on a safe street. Has a grocery store and a couple of laundromats very close-by. Also close to many tourist attractions. Close to Union Square, Grace Cathedral, both cable car routes, the list goes on. Hotel is very well situated. I had a great 5 night stay. My room was spacious, with a walk-in closet, very clean, with a kitchenette. Free breakfast (I'm not going to complain about free food), free computers with internet and a printer. The only thing that wasn't great was that the phone in my room didn't work. But the staff were friendly and I got their help in what I needed to do. Plus with the internet, I didn't miss the phone. This is a clean, proper hotel but at a fraction of the cost. This is the ONLY place I will go to when I go back to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough stay”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Kelly
Reviews.Content: I liked the hotel overall but thought it was a little scruffy around the edges. I've posted two pictures to illustrate this. It may be picky but it's good to show you the pictures they don't show you on the hotel site! The overall hotel wasn't terrible just a little old. Stay here by all means if you like to save money for other things as i do. I did like their lobby and there quirky old lift . The kitchen was good and the room had free wireless. But somebody should hire a new maintenance guy.

Reviews.Title: “carpark from hell”
Reviews.Author: superduper
Reviews.Content: I didn't hate the Mayflower but there was definately room for improvement. The location is fine, close to Union Square. The price is reasonable but then again the property is very old and it's not sensational value for money, just ok. The staff were all very friendly. Check in was slow but the bill was correct after the car-park charge was added so all went well there. The lobby was homely but i never received any information about the surrounding area or that 'introductory talk' you usually get, however brief. Having returned home i now have come to realise that there was a free breakfast included. I was never told my room included this. Unlike in the British Isles the breakfast is very 'continental' in US hotels. All you get is a bun and a cup of tea so it would hardly have killed them to included the breakfast for us. I thought this was a bit stingy or if it was an oversight it was a very bad one. The room was a bit troublesome. We had a good sized walk in closet and a very useful kitchette which was basic but clean. The room was a good size especially as we only had one double bed in it. Oh yes the bed. Are you extremely skinny? Grand you should be ok fitting two people in it so! It was the tiniest 'queen' i ever did see. Maybe it came from the Victorian Days when everybody was teeny. Two average people would have trouble fitting in it. No real problem, just ask for twin beds or a King. The curtains were the usual rubbish. No problem for me with sunshine however , as I was down a laneway and had a view into somebody else window of another building across . I asked for the quiet side so thats why i got that room so i didn't mind. Free wireless was a good feature if you bring your laptop. Hotels in Vegas wanted to charge this as extra so fair play to the Mayflower, they have it completely free for unlimited time. In fact the cheaper the hotels the more generous they were with wireless. The hotel is old. Very old. The lift is old. The carpark is older. It cannot accommodate big american tanks. They ask you 'is your car big'. Unfortunately our hire car company gave us a big 4x4 that we managed to scratch on the walls of this carpark even though the guy working there tried to help direct us out. And were not talking wing mirrors, were talking the body of the car, thats how tight it is. The wing mirrors have to be folded in.The driver is experienced and had been driving the car for a week. Now seriously i cannot reccommmend anybody with a car book this hotel. It is RIDICULOUS. They need to come up with an alternative place to park the cars or else park it somewhere else yourself and dont avail of the hotel car-park. Its 20dollars? i think anyway. Thats my advice. You have been warned...

Reviews.Title: “great hotel lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: michellek103
Reviews.Content: stayed here for three nights in June with my boyfriend. Thought location was great..few minutes walk from Union Sq. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean and modern.. had a huge walk in waldrobe-great to throw your luggage into and not have things everywhere! The room was similar to ant decent hotel room and had a microwave,fridge,cutlery,etc. Great for travellers who cannot afford to eat out constantly.. esp on the expensive West Coast. Good car parking rates availalbe..another rariity in SF. Would highly recommend staying here. Lovely Irish staff also! Hotel also very secure.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy at the Mayflower”
Reviews.Author: love2travel021
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mayflower for 5 nights, including New Years. We had a wonderful and wouldn't have picked another hotel. A little background: my husband and have lived in big cities including Atlanta, Chicago and San Francisco. My husband lived in the Russian Hill area of San Francisco for over 2 years just a few years ago. Now for the review: the hotel was very clean, including our room. When we checked in we were given a tour by the owner's (Nancy) husband. He showed all us all the different rooms, and gave us a choice of what room we wanted. It is a good idea to do this as all the rooms are bit different and you may find one you like more than another. For example, some rooms have newer refrigerators than others, different cabinetry, etc. They are in the (slow) process of remodeling the wet bar in each room and when they are all done they will look great! Currently, most of them are quite old, but still in good condition. We really enjoyed having a mini fridge and microwave in our room and was one of the many reasons we chose the Mayflower. We also picked a room on a higher floor, as the first and second floors are more open to street noise and are also colder. Since we went in the winter, we wanted to be warmer without using the heat (to avoid stuffiness). We kept the window open most of our stay and the noise was negligible. My husband sleeps with earplugs and is an extremely light sleeper and we both slept well. The bathroom fixtures are new, with old and neat bones still in place. The entire hotel is like this really, with the lovely features that old buildings have still in place, but modernized. We found the staff very helpful and friendly for the most part. Some of the night staff were kind of disinterested, but at that point we were heading to bed and really didn't care. The breakfast that some people raved about was just so-so in our opinion. It's great that they offer it, but we weren't impressed. It's a nice continental breakfast, don't expect more than that. We didn't, and weren't disappointed because of it. Previous reviewers were not kidding about the size of the garage. It is so narrow you have to see it to believe it. Our rental ford focus barely fit, and I mean by mere centimeters. We switched cars mid way through our stay and our Toyota Corolla was a better fit, but not by much. The garage has to be opened manually, and if you come and go frequently, it can be a bit annoying to stop and get out of the car, have someone open the garage and drive it down, but it's not that bad. Especially when you consider the price, the narrowness and slight inconvenience are all worth it. Our room's walk in closet had a funky odor, but I didn't find it obnoxious or offensive. I think it's just from being closed and not often used. Just sort of stale smelling. I hung my clothes in it and they didn't absorb any of the odor. The water pressure in our room was fine, we didn't find it weak at all. The linens were clean and very homey. The neighborhood is just fine. We came and went at all hours of the day and night and encountered no issues whatsoever. The hotel is near the area aslo known as the noberloin or tendernob, a blend of one of the sketchiest areas in SF and one of the ritziest. You turn one corner and you're in sketchville, you turn another and you're surrounded by high end restaurants and hotels. But the Mayflower is closer to the Nob than the Loin. The hotel is locked at night to make sure only guests enter. We walked to Union Square, and Nob Hill and I am in not such great shape, and it was not that bad. The previous poster who complained about the distance and hills - puhlease! If you like driving everywhere, go visit a suburb. We walked up two giant hills to get to Nob Hill and survived. It was fun. The area is good. And for the price, I would say the area is great. I think you would be hard pressed to find such a good deal any where else in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeonardoAversa
Reviews.Content: I spent five days at the Mayflower. It's really a great option for less than a hundred dollars. The location is great, near Union Square and the room mas very big. Tou have free internet and , if you need you can also have a parking (for US$20). The breakfast is ok. A very good choice, much better ( and cheaper) than the motels at Lombard street.

Reviews.Title: “Good If on a budget, average for everything else.”
Reviews.Author: CdnWT
Reviews.Content: Here is some background information before I jump on to the review. This past October, I traveled with a friend to San Francisco during the Canadian thanksgiving week-end and what coincided in San Francisco as Fleet week. The Blue Angels flew over the city a few times which was quite neat, although the public transit system downtown was overwhelmed, especially the cable car. Fact was, we learned that after booking our plane tickets and we were left hanging to find a decent hotel at a decent price. We're both university students in our early 20s and I'm pretty well traveled. Usually, I tend to select slightly plusher accomodation (thanks to a good job despite the student status), in the likes of Marriott, Hyatt, etc. Due to rates at 300$+ with limited availability, we booked the Mayflower for a night at 125$ for a "Superior room", 45$ more than their standard room, but that would apparently afford us a room higher up and with a view. Given how many people mentionned noise problems, we decided to upgrade. Bottom line, I have a good connection and we were lucky to move to the W for the last two nights. I'll break down the review in two sections, positives and negatives. POSITIVE: -True to the reviews here, Nancy, the owner, is a very nice and helpful lady. A younger Spanish speaking woman working that night was also very nice. That can't be said for the rest of the staff we encountered. -Hallway carpets looked brand new and so did he hallways in general. I agree, everything must have been painted quite recently. Room carpets looked maybe a little older but were still very clean. -Old style elevators but remodeled. -Very nice lobby, front desk and charming breakfast room with a very good continental breakfast included in the room rate, comprising breads, cereals, fruits and coffee/tea/juice/milk and finally yoghurt. -Plumbing related bathroom fixtures obviosuly brand new and no hot water problems. -Free WiFi a big plus. -Kitchenette with fridge and microwave helpful for longer stays. -Plenty of toiletries, including soap, shampoo, lotion and mouthwash. NEGATIVE: -The man who checked us in was a little sketchy and caught off guard smoking outside as we were walking in to register. They do not take credit card information at the time of reservation but will require payment at check-in rather than check-out, even when paying by credit card which I found odd. I asked to see the room first. I recommend you do the same. -Some staff members were rude, including the first gentleman who made the reservation for us over the phone. Completely disinterested. -The kitchenette's glassware was quite visibly unclean, the wine glasses in our room all had either lip gloss or fingerprints on them. -We did not think not having Air conditioning was going to be a problem early Oct. in SFO but given our room faced the sun all afternoon, it was stuffy in there. We therefore kept the window open and it was VERY noisy as a result, despite facing the back. The room did not cool down much before around 3 am when a bunch of drunks yelling woke us up.and we decided to close the window. Ceiling fan helped a bit but I get congested when sleeping with that running so shut it off in the middle of the night. -My bedspread and pillowcases had old blood stains on them. -Room cleanliness was so-so with dust clearly visible in corners and our walk-in had a stench which prevented from storing any luggage in there. -Bathroom, other than fixtures, is clean but old and the shower head as a result came right around the level of my forehead. I'm only 5'9. You can imagine my 6'3 friend had a lot of fun washing his hair in the morning. Took forever given the weak pressure. -The alleged view was pretty much non-existent, our room, despite being on the 5th floor, overlooked neighboring buildings that obstructed most of the view. -Mattresses are brand new (according to their tags) but both me and my friend found them uncomfortable due to firmness. This is more subjective though. -I would disagree the location being good or great. The neighborhood was not re-assuring at night. I would not walk there alone and I'm a guy. Not much around and pretty much everything requires a steep walk downhill or uphill, making transit use mandatory. Union Square is a good 10-15 minute walk. Bottom line, the location is O.K. Nothing more. Would I return to the Mayflower? Possibly If nothing else was available. Based on what I experienced, I can understand why people on a budget like it. It's a roof over your head with a breakfast included. I also thought the 45 additional dollars for a higher floor room was a waste of money, given the rooms lower were described on the phone as being virtually identical. The said view was non-existent and the room, just as noisy as that 80$ room probably was. I probably would have felt I got a better bang for my buck with that room type. If looking for a place to sleep that's relatively clean and safely guarded, accessible by public transit to most of SFO's attractions and cheap, the Mayflower will do it. If you're like us and like your comfort and convenience location-wise, they are wiser options.

Reviews.Title: “Very good deal and very friendly! Going back there!!”
Reviews.Author: HaoHaoBeijing_
Reviews.Content: The first week, we stayed at The Fairmont but, because of a major convention, we had to leave there and went to The Mayflower. Our room at The Mayflower was half the price of The Fairmont with many extras, including a garage for the car. We had free wireless ($14.95 a day at The Fairmont) and free continental breakfast ($33 for breakfast at The Fairmont). Quaint atmosphere and felt more like "old San Francisco", but very clean and neat. We will go back for another night before returning to China.

Reviews.Title: “It had it's ups and downs”
Reviews.Author: ellie2288
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay overall but when we checked in we had some serious problems with the managers. Because of some miscommunication with the number of people traveling with us, we had too many people in the room. While the woman who was helping us was very helpful, the man who was also was there was unnecessarily rude and almost yelling at us. It is absolutely ridiculous how he was treating us and completely disrespectful. He was the only problem we had with the hotel, the rooms were big and the bathrooms were nice. I would recommend it as a budget hotel that you are using just for sleep. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Price, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Northern_Rock
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mayflower with another couple. Two rooms between 3 of us. The hotel is situated in a very good location, near to Union Square, with a garage in the next block. The staff, Nancy and Nick, are friendly and extremely helpful. Rooms are clean, with two huge wardrobes, a very comfy bed and overall this "theme" hotel has a very cosy charm. It's not posh, but heck, it's not meant to be. At the prices offered, this is a really, really good deal - with breakfast (albeit simple) thrown in too. HIghly recommended, no complaints whatsoever. Just read the other reviews. This hotel is ranked in the top 50 out of 240 hotels in SFO, including the high end pricier posher ones. I guess that affirms my view.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, lots of character”
Reviews.Author: kimz92684
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for what we wanted. It had a central location, it was inexpensive and it had parking. It was very old and they were in the process of remodeling, it had lots of character, which made it fun. Nice beds, clean rooms, we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: dinkydoll
Reviews.Content: Myself and my 2 friends stayed at The Mayflower for 3 nights in July and we were most impressed! The staff were all very friendly and when we arrived they gave us a map and told us where we should head to in the city and where the nearest bus/cable stops were - they even gave us a bottle of wine from the nearby Napa Valley to take to our room! The rooms were a good size, the beds were very comfortable and although there wasn't air con there was a large ceiling fan which was more than adequate... our room had a small kitchenette with a fridge and microwave and 2 very large walk in cupboards. Breakfast was basic but more than fine for the rate we paid. Location-wise this hotel is perfect, it is in a safe area and within walking distance to all the attractions in San Francisco. This is an old building but that adds to the charm! The lift in the reception area is particularly dinky! Oh and an added bonus was the computer area with free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Great value & nice staff”
Reviews.Author: SimonGarvey
Reviews.Content: Chosen on Tripadviser recommendations. Excellent place and very friendly and helpful staff, especially Nancy. Even returned things we had left behind. Difficult to believe that the combination of location and price can be beaten. Great sandwiches next door.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected for the price”
Reviews.Author: Derfel
Reviews.Content: I didn't get off to a good start here, as my rental Chevy Impala wouldn't fit through their garage doors. But it all picked up after that. The staff was very friendly, my room looked like it had been recently painted -- as did the corridors -- which is good in a building as old as this one. (The elevators are the kind that require you to open the door to get out.) My room had a small kitchenette with a tiny fridge, microwave, a sink, counter space, a couple of plates, a couple of bowls, and a fork. (Not sure what you would put in a bowl that you can eat with a fork.) No A.C., but there was a ceiling fan. That was fine. I got a room on the "quiet" side -- and it was, even though the Mayflower is in the heart of the city, between Union Square and Nob Hill. For those not real familiar with Nob Hill, if you're going to Grace Cathedral, be warned that the 2 blocks between the Mayflower and the Cathedral are about the steepest blocks you'll ever see. The Powell-Hyde cable car, which is good for getting around, is a quick 3 blocks away. The Mayflower offers a complimentary breakfast of sorts, which seems increasingly common in hotels/motels. Muffins, packaged cheese, coffee, bananas, orange juice, milk, cereal.... Price for 2 nights was $175 total. Absolutely no complaints, and would stay there again. But I'll rent a smaller car next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: hinkgen
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Mayflower is a great place to stay with children. The room we had offered a full-size bed and a twin trundle. The room was very clean, and the no a.c. didn't bug us because the weather was cool and the ceiling fans did the trick. We loved the multiple closets our room offered, it allowed us to stay tidy and stash stuff during our stay. Parking was handy...plenty big once you get down into the garage, but beware, the driveway is extremely narrow. This place is old, old, old...but we found the hotel gave us some real San Francisco flavor. The location is perfect, close to everything. Staff was attentive and friendly. You can't beat it for the price...especially including a light breakfast each day...NICE!

Reviews.Title: “A great, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: SJMcG
Reviews.Content: The staff here were really friendly and were very helpful. They told us were to go and where not to go. The rooms are clean and a good size. Our room contained two large cupboards, a microwave and a 'fridge. The property is old and is not your modern day fancy hotel - but this adds to the charm. check out the old fashioned elevators! It is centrally located and within walking distance of most things. The breakfast is a simple buffet and quite basic - but fine. If I were to stay in San Francisco I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel experience of my life!”
Reviews.Author: Zayjah
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a room at the Hotel Mayflower for the last two nights of our California vacation. We chose the Mayflower because the picture of the lobby looked nice, it was cheap, and we had been splurging on pricier rooms for most of our trip. We checked in and went to check out our room - we we're very disappointed with everything beyond the lobby. It's like an old senior apartment building. It smelled like a nursing home and the bed looked 25 years old - with a dip in the middle of the mattress. Oh well, we'd make due I thought. We went back to the car to get our luggage and when we returned, the front door was locked. I rattled the doorknob, my husband pushed on the other side, I was going to ring the buzzer, but looked in and saw someone coming to the door. He peeked out and said "Did you kick the door? You kicked the door. Find another motel, I don't want you here." And then he slammed the door. I thought it was a joke at first, or he was a crazy resident, or even that it was a scam to get our money. Turns out he was legitimately kicking us out for allegedly kicking the door. It was insane! Here we had paid for our room, and we're struggling to the door with all our luggage and IT"S LOCKED. Do you think we could perhaps be offered some HELP from the staff for goodness sake. NO, we're locked out and then KICKED OUT ! We were dumbfounded and quite angry for being treated so rudely , but agreed we'd never dream of staying there after being treated this way anyways and so we waited for them to refund our credit card and left quietly. We SO wanted to kick the door for real on the way out! This story has a happy ending. We found a MUCH NICER hotel a few blocks away - Hotel Carlton- The staff was kind, the decor was new, everything was clean, even valet parking for only $20 more a night!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Mayflower
HotelInfo.Address: 975 Bush Street, San Francisco, CA 94109
